documentation.brief: Convert scalars to flux or circulation vectors.
documentation.long: Often times a simulation that computes circulation or flux in a mesh will simply write out the scalar that represents the amount of movement and the direction is implied by the normal of the surface cell (for flux) or the direction of the line cell (for circulation). The array values associated with the 2D and 1D geometric elements will be converted to a vector pointing in the direction of the flow.

domain.text:
The dataset must contain a field array (cell)
with 1 component(s).

documentation.long: The name of the scalar array that represents flux through a 2D element or circulation along a 1D element. This array will be converted to a vector pointing in the direction the flow or circulation is moving.

domain.text: An array of scalars is required.
The value must be field array name.

documentation.long: If off, then the input array is taken to be the total flux through or circulation along each element. If on, then the input array is taken to be the density of the flux or circulation.

documentation.brief: Create glyphs pointing in the direction of flux or circulation.
documentation.long: Circulation is a vector field on 1D cells that represents flow along the path of the cell. Flux is a vector field on 2D cells that represents flow through the area of the cell. This filter creates arrow glyphs in the direction of the flow. The array values associated with the 2D and 1D geometric elements will be converted to a vector pointing in the direction of the flow.

domain.text: The dataset must contain a field array (cell)

documentation.long: The name of the scalar or vector array that represents flux through a 2D element or circulation along a 1D element. If necessary, this array will be converted to a vector pointing in the direction the flow or circulation is moving.

domain.text: An array of scalars is required.
The value must be field array name.

documentation.long: If off, then the input array is taken to be the total flux through or circulation along each element. If on, then the input array is taken to be the density of the flux or circulation.
If off, then the glyphs are scaled by the total flux through or circulation along each element. If on, then the glyphs are scaled by the flux or circulation density.
